sections: Facebook is about to decide if you're a journalist or not
Long-term readers will be familiar with my amusement watching social platforms tie themselves in knots
trying to decide who is a journalist
Well, it looks like Facebook is about to do that again.

It appears that it's going to be an inherited system: if you managed to get your Facebook Page through the verification process to be registered as a News Page, people working for that organisation can get journalist verification.

I'm not quite sure where that will leave freelancers, though. Given that they are the most vulnerable group of journalists, lacking the weight of a decent-sized publisher to back them up, that does seem like a serious oversight in a scheme whose stated purpose is to offer journalists more protectionâ€¦
SEO: Google is sending a smaller percentage of queries to websites
This shouldn't be a surprise to anyone who has been paying attention to how Google has been shifting in the past few years, but it does lay out the change very nicely.
The solution is simple: don't optimise for anything that can be answered simply. Optimise for in-depth explanations, contextualization and answers.
